articles.author: Kate Park
articles.title: Apple announces new settlement with Japan allowing developers to link to external websites
articles.description: Apple has made a settlement with Japanese regulator that it will allow developers of “reader” apps link to their own website for managing users account. The change goes to effect in early 2022. This settlement comes after the Japan Fair Trade Commission (JFTC…
articles.content:

articles.author: Kellen Browning
articles.title: Apple Plans Another Tweak to Its Strict App Store Rules
articles.description: The change, which affects apps like Spotify and Netflix, will allow developers to steer users to their websites rather than the App Store.
articles.content:
Apple said on Wednesday that it was adjusting its App Store policies to allow certain kinds of applications to do business more directly with their customers.
Under the change, so-called reader apps… [+842 chars]

articles.title: Apple Letting 'Reader' Apps Offer Links for Account Sign Ups Outside of the App Store to Close Japan Investigation
articles.description: Apple today announced that the Japan Fair Trade Commission (JFTC) has agreed to close its App Store investigation in exchange for changes to how "reader" apps like Netflix operate. Reader apps allow users to browse previously purchased content or content subs…
